values.description:
Renaming to conform to google cpp style: https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#General_Naming_Rules

"When abbreviations appear in such names, prefer to capitalize the abbreviations as single words (i.e. StartRpc(), not StartRPC())."
values.title: Rename REST to Rest

values.description:
This builds on top of these two independent pull requests, please review them first:

* ~~pull request #55~~ (which itself is on top of ~~pull request #54~~)
* ~~pull request #56~~

---

This addresses issue #45 and issue #39:

1. Rearranges the local cache to take the following directory structure:

        /home/louise/.ignition/fuel/
        ├── config.yaml
        └── osrf
            ├── caguero
            │   └── models
            │       ├── Ambulance3
            │       └── Hammer
            ├── chapulina
            │   └── models
            │       └── Turtlebot
            └── german
                └── models
                    ├── Bowl
                    └── Cardboard Box


    Where `osrf` corresponds to the name of the `api.ignitionfuel.org` server on the default `config.yaml` file.

1. Now model directories may have spaces

1. Also added `FuelClient::CachedModel`, and pointed on the documentation that `FuelClient::DownloadModel` will override an existing local model if called. I opted for having separate functions to be more easily able to force downloads from Gazebo, please let me know if there was another intended way of doing this originally (CC @sloretz)
values.title: Change cache directory structure and use it

summary.raw:
This builds on top of these two independent pull requests, please review them first:

* ~~pull request #55~~ (which itself is on top of ~~pull request #54~~)
* ~~pull request #56~~

---

This addresses issue #45 and issue #39:

1. Rearranges the local cache to take the following directory structure:

        /home/louise/.ignition/fuel/
        ├── config.yaml
        └── osrf
            ├── caguero
            │   └── models
            │       ├── Ambulance3
            │       └── Hammer
            ├── chapulina
            │   └── models
            │       └── Turtlebot
            └── german
                └── models
                    ├── Bowl
                    └── Cardboard Box


    Where `osrf` corresponds to the name of the `api.ignitionfuel.org` server on the default `config.yaml` file.

1. Now model directories may have spaces

1. Also added `FuelClient::CachedModel`, and pointed on the documentation that `FuelClient::DownloadModel` will override an existing local model if called. I opted for having separate functions to be more easily able to force downloads from Gazebo, please let me know if there was another intended way of doing this originally (CC @sloretz)
summary.html:
This builds on top of these two independent pull requests, please review them first:

  • pull request #55 (which itself is on top of pull request #54)
  • pull request #56

This addresses issue #45 and issue #39:

  1. Rearranges the local cache to take the following directory structure:

    /home/louise/.ignition/fuel/
├── config.yaml
└── osrf
    ├── caguero
    │   └── models
    │       ├── Ambulance3
    │       └── Hammer
    ├── chapulina
    │   └── models
    │       └── Turtlebot
    └── german
        └── models
            ├── Bowl
            └── Cardboard Box

    Where osrf corresponds to the name of the api.ignitionfuel.org server on the default config.yaml file.

  2. Now model directories may have spaces

  3. Also added FuelClient::CachedModel, and pointed on the documentation that FuelClient::DownloadModel will override an existing local model if called. I opted for having separate functions to be more easily able to force downloads from Gazebo, please let me know if there was another intended way of doing this originally (CC @sloretz)

values.description: Now that servers will be identified only by their URLs and the URLs will be used on the cache directory name (pull request #58), it is convenient to use `common::URI` for the URLs, so we can easily check for validity and separate the scheme from the host.
values.title: Use common::URI for server URL

summary.raw: Now that servers will be identified only by their URLs and the URLs will be used on the cache directory name (pull request #58), it is convenient to use `common::URI` for the URLs, so we can easily check for validity and separate the scheme from the host.
summary.html: Now that servers will be identified only by their URLs and the URLs will be used on the cache directory name (pull request #58), it is convenient to use common::URI for the URLs, so we can easily check for validity and separate the scheme from the host.

values.description:
Pagination was not working because the query params were being passed embedded on the path instead of the separate query argument, which caused:

1. The query symbols `?` and `=` to be encoded
1. The query `?` to be duplicate

This PR fixes it. Running `ign fuel list -t model` should return more than just 20 models now
values.title: Fix pagination query

summary.raw:
Pagination was not working because the query params were being passed embedded on the path instead of the separate query argument, which caused:

1. The query symbols `?` and `=` to be encoded
1. The query `?` to be duplicate

This PR fixes it. Running `ign fuel list -t model` should return more than just 20 models now
summary.html:
Pagination was not working because the query params were being passed embedded on the path instead of the separate query argument, which caused:

  1. The query symbols ? and = to be encoded
  2. The query ? to be duplicate

This PR fixes it. Running ign fuel list -t model should return more than just 20 models now

values.description:
The `FuelClient::Models` functions were returning all cached models for invalid servers.

This change makes it so that only cached models from that server are returned, so the return for an invalid server will always be empty.
values.title: Client return only relevant cached models

summary.raw:
The `FuelClient::Models` functions were returning all cached models for invalid servers.

This change makes it so that only cached models from that server are returned, so the return for an invalid server will always be empty.
summary.html:
The FuelClient::Models functions were returning all cached models for invalid servers.

This change makes it so that only cached models from that server are returned, so the return for an invalid server will always be empty.

values.description: The `LocalCache` can already return the path to the root of a cached model. This pull request adds the ability to get the local path to a model resource file, such as a mesh or a texture. This is important because Gazebo looks for resources independently of each other.
values.title: Get cached model resource file

summary.raw: The `LocalCache` can already return the path to the root of a cached model. This pull request adds the ability to get the local path to a model resource file, such as a mesh or a texture. This is important because Gazebo looks for resources independently of each other.
summary.html: The LocalCache can already return the path to the root of a cached model. This pull request adds the ability to get the local path to a model resource file, such as a mesh or a texture. This is important because Gazebo looks for resources independently of each other.

values.description:
Adds all the new functions, without deprecating the old ones. I didn't change the instances which use the old functions.

Motivation:

1. Decrease the diff between branches 1 and default so it is easier to port changes
1. Keep API more consistent (for example, pull request #65 adds `SetVersion`, which uses a different style from the old API in v1)

PTAL @nkoenig
values.title: Backport pull request #52 to v1

values.description:
![downcmd2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/ekkEdGa/images/1937599142-downcmd2.png)

Tips:

* If you've installed version 2, use `--force-version 1.1.0`
* Run maximum verbosity: `-v 4`

Some example commands:

~~~
ign fuel download --force-version 1.1.0 -v 4 --url https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/openrobotics/models/Ambulance/
ign fuel download --force-version 1.1.0 -v 4 --url https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/openrobotics/models/Ambulance/tip
ign fuel download --force-version 1.1.0 -v 4 --url https://api.ignitionfuel.org/openrobotics/models/Ambulance/
~~~
values.title: Download model from command line

values.description:
A model may have several versions, which are numbered starting from 1 and `tip` refers to the latest available version.

The new local cache structure is the following:

~~~
/home/louise/.ignition/fuel/
├── config.yaml
└── localhost:8000
    └── chapulina
        └── models
            └── Custom drill
                ├── 1
                │   ├── materials
                │   │   └── textures
                │   │       └── cordless_drill.png
                │   ├── meshes
                │   │   ├── cordless_drill.dae
                │   │   └── cordless_drill.stl
                │   ├── model.config
                │   └── model.sdf
                ├── 2
                │   ├── materials
                │   │   └── textures
                │   │       └── cordless_drill.png
                │   ├── meshes
                │   │   ├── cordless_drill.dae
                │   │   └── cordless_drill.stl
                │   ├── model.config
                │   └── model.sdf
                └── (no more tip symlink!)
~~~

Note that the `tip` is a symlink to the highest version, in this case `2`.

You can test this using the command line tool like this for example:

~~~
ign fuel download -v 4 --force-version 1.1.0 -u "https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/chapulina/models/Test box"
~~~

Note that when downloading the tip, the version will be hardcoded to 1 until [this PR](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuelserver/pull-requests/135/return-x-ign-resource-version-header-in/diff) is deployed on the backend.
values.title: Cache model versions side-by-side

A model may have several versions, which are numbered starting from 1 and tip refers to the latest available version.

The new local cache structure is the following:

/home/louise/.ignition/fuel/
├── config.yaml

    └── chapulina

You can test this using the command line tool like this for example:

Note that when downloading the tip, the version will be hardcoded to 1 until this PR is deployed on the backend.

values.description:
This PR makes it easier to build gazebo `default` branch with ignition fuel support using colcon. ~~The same change already exists on ~~`default`~~.~~ *Edit: Copy paste error, the change isn’t on default on this repo yet, though it is on ign-common*

Eliminating the variable from the `find_package()` call enables colcon to discover the dependency without needing a `package.xml` or `colcon.meta` entry.
values.title: Switch order of variable and find_package() for colcon

summary.raw:
This PR makes it easier to build gazebo `default` branch with ignition fuel support using colcon. ~~The same change already exists on ~~`default`~~.~~ *Edit: Copy paste error, the change isn’t on default on this repo yet, though it is on ign-common*

Eliminating the variable from the `find_package()` call enables colcon to discover the dependency without needing a `package.xml` or `colcon.meta` entry.
summary.html:
This PR makes it easier to build gazebo default branch with ignition fuel support using colcon. The same change already exists on default. Edit: Copy paste error, the change isn’t on default on this repo yet, though it is on ign-common

Eliminating the variable from the find_package() call enables colcon to discover the dependency without needing a package.xml or colcon.meta entry.

values.description:
Builds on top of pull request #78

---

Duplicate all functionality currently available to models to worlds.

Most of the code is a direct copy, but I did some refactoring with the intent of reducing the number of shared private headers and friend classes.

### Main differences

* The functionality of `Model` and `ModelIdentifier` was merged into `WorldIdentifier`
* Only the API currently used was ported, so I left out things like `Tags` and `UploadDate`
* All the API should follow the new style
* Also made a change so that the local path of a downloaded model is propagated from the `Save*` function to the functions who called it. For `Model`, we're reconstructing that path, which is not ideal.

### Try it out

List worlds

`ign fuel list --force-version 1.2.0 -t world -u https://staging-api.ignitionfuel.org`

Download a world

`ign fuel download --force-version 1.2.0 -v 4 -u https://staging-api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/chapulina/worlds/Empty`
values.title: Worlds

summary.raw:
Builds on top of pull request #78

---

Duplicate all functionality currently available to models to worlds.

Most of the code is a direct copy, but I did some refactoring with the intent of reducing the number of shared private headers and friend classes.

### Main differences

* The functionality of `Model` and `ModelIdentifier` was merged into `WorldIdentifier`
* Only the API currently used was ported, so I left out things like `Tags` and `UploadDate`
* All the API should follow the new style
* Also made a change so that the local path of a downloaded model is propagated from the `Save*` function to the functions who called it. For `Model`, we're reconstructing that path, which is not ideal.

### Try it out

List worlds

`ign fuel list --force-version 1.2.0 -t world -u https://staging-api.ignitionfuel.org`

Download a world

`ign fuel download --force-version 1.2.0 -v 4 -u https://staging-api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/chapulina/worlds/Empty`
summary.html:
Builds on top of pull request #78

Duplicate all functionality currently available to models to worlds.

Most of the code is a direct copy, but I did some refactoring with the intent of reducing the number of shared private headers and friend classes.

Main differences

  • The functionality of Model and ModelIdentifier was merged into WorldIdentifier
  • Only the API currently used was ported, so I left out things like Tags and UploadDate
  • All the API should follow the new style
  • Also made a change so that the local path of a downloaded model is propagated from the Save* function to the functions who called it. For Model, we're reconstructing that path, which is not ideal.

Try it out

List worlds

ign fuel list --force-version 1.2.0 -t world -u https://staging-api.ignitionfuel.org

Download a world

ign fuel download --force-version 1.2.0 -v 4 -u https://staging-api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/chapulina/worlds/Empty

values.description:
Changes api.ignitionfuel.org to fuel.ignitionrobotics.org and bumps major version. The major version bump is done because the default server is now api.ignitionfuel.org, we are using a newer version of ign-cmake, and I wanted to leave ign-fuel-tools2 in state that can be upgraded/modified as needed by the Gazebo9/10 lineage. 

This PR does not fix codecheck or compiler warnings. Part 2 will address these.

The api.iginitionfuel.org server will remain active,  and usable.
values.title: Part 1 of pull request #82.

summary.raw:
Changes api.ignitionfuel.org to fuel.ignitionrobotics.org and bumps major version. The major version bump is done because the default server is now api.ignitionfuel.org, we are using a newer version of ign-cmake, and I wanted to leave ign-fuel-tools2 in state that can be upgraded/modified as needed by the Gazebo9/10 lineage. 

This PR does not fix codecheck or compiler warnings. Part 2 will address these.

The api.iginitionfuel.org server will remain active,  and usable.
summary.html:
Changes api.ignitionfuel.org to fuel.ignitionrobotics.org and bumps major version. The major version bump is done because the default server is now api.ignitionfuel.org, we are using a newer version of ign-cmake, and I wanted to leave ign-fuel-tools2 in state that can be upgraded/modified as needed by the Gazebo9/10 lineage.

This PR does not fix codecheck or compiler warnings. Part 2 will address these.

The api.iginitionfuel.org server will remain active, and usable.

values.description:
This establishes the default fuel server in code, rather than in a config.yaml file. This follows the principle of making the default simple with requiring a special configuration.

A user that doesn't want the default server can call `Clear`.
values.title: Part 5: Hardcode default fuel server.

summary.raw:
This establishes the default fuel server in code, rather than in a config.yaml file. This follows the principle of making the default simple with requiring a special configuration.

A user that doesn't want the default server can call `Clear`.
summary.html:
This establishes the default fuel server in code, rather than in a config.yaml file. This follows the principle of making the default simple with requiring a special configuration.

A user that doesn't want the default server can call Clear.

values.description:
I need to pass in a JWT token to `ign fuel download` in order to download private models. This will be needed when creating docker images for the tunnel circuit. 

Example usage:

```
ign fuel download --url "https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/nate/models/jersey_private" --header "authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"
```
values.title: Expose HTTP headers on model download

summary.raw:
I need to pass in a JWT token to `ign fuel download` in order to download private models. This will be needed when creating docker images for the tunnel circuit. 

Example usage:

```
ign fuel download --url "https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/nate/models/jersey_private" --header "authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"
```
summary.html:
I need to pass in a JWT token to ign fuel download in order to download private models. This will be needed when creating docker images for the tunnel circuit.

Example usage:

ign fuel download --url "https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/nate/models/jersey_private" --header "authorization: Bearer YOUR_JWT_TOKEN"
